original_body_lines: A group of 41 illegal Sri Lankan immigrants who were arrested and deported by Australian authorities arrived at the Katunayake International Airport this morning.
They had travelled by sea on board multiday fishing trawlers, only to be arrested in their attempt to enter Australia. They had been detained on Christmas Island pending deportation.
Investigations revealed that the majority of them were from the Jaffna and Valaichchenai areas.
Three senior officials of the Australian High Commission in Sri Lanka were at Katunayake International Airport to hand over the group to the Sri Lankan Immigration and Emigration Authorities.

The suspects were to be handed over to the CID unit at the Katunayake International Airport and produced before the Negombo magistrate after preliminary investigations conducted by the National Intelligence authorities. (T.K.G.Kapila)
